title: MOOC Learning Engagement and Design Analysis: Intensive Workshop Based on Educational Process Mining

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: A customized course for professionals in medical, legal, and technical fields to enhance their competency in analyzing MOOC learning data.

learning_goals: Learners visualize three or more learning engagement patterns (e.g., login frequency, content completion rates) using educational process mining tools (Celonis, Disco) and propose two or more improvement strategies based on derived insights.

In vocational training, learners analyze key activity paths (login frequency, content usage patterns) for three or more groups (new hires, experienced workers, current employees) and propose two or more customized learning design strategies (e.g., recommended content, study schedules) for each group.
Develop a participation persistence prediction model based on MOOC learning activity sequence data
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
